metadata.title: CVE-2016-5636 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the get_data function in zipimport.c in CPython (aka Python) before 2.7.12, 3.x before 3.4.5, and 3.5.x before 3.5.2 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a negative data size value, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-5636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-3
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-3
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-3
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-3
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-3
python2.7 - 2.7.12-3
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-3
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-3
No subscription required

notes.note: sbeattie> issue is fixed for xenial/python3.5 and xenial/python2.7 for packages in xenial-updates, but not xenial-security may also need https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/2edbdb79cd6d (see comment on python bug above) for pre-2.7.8 code and possibly 3.x code.

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-3').
